questions.text: A study is conducted to find the relationship between the height and weight of school students. Which of the following would be useful in this study?
questions.solution:
The coefficient of correlation can be used to determine the relationship between both variables in this scenario. It is used to express the strength and direction of the relationship between two variables.

It is represented by the letter 'r'. Its value ranges from -1 to +1. 

Related Pearl: Correlation

Correlation expresses the strength and direction of the relationship between two variables in terms of a correlation coefficient. It is represented by r.

  • Values of r vary from -1 (perfect negative correlation) to +1 (perfect positive correlation).
  • Value (size) of the coefficient: Indicates the strength of relationship
  • Sign of the coefficient: Indicates direction of relationship

Coefficients between ±0.5 and 1 are regarded as strong whereas those between ±0.5 and 0 are regarded as weak.

The data is plotted in a scattergram as shown in the examples given below

Examples:

Types of correlation coefficients

  1. Pearson coefficient
  2. Spearman coefficient

Coefficient of Determination (CD) =  r2

It is simply the percentage variability in one factor due to change in another variable.

questions.text: Which among the following is false about correlation?

choices.text: It indicates the strength of relationship between 2 variables
Correlation coefficient of 1 indicates a linear relationship

questions.solution:
A correlation between 2 variables only indicates the strength of the relationship between two variables, not causation. 

A correlation coefficient of 1 indicates a linear relationship. It cannot measure the risk.

Related Pearl: Correlation

Correlation expresses the strength and direction of the relationship between two variables in terms of a correlation coefficient. It is represented by r.

  • Values of r vary from -1 (perfect negative correlation) to +1 (perfect positive correlation).
  • Value (size) of the coefficient: Indicates the strength of relationship
  • Sign of the coefficient: Indicates direction of relationship

Coefficients between ±0.5 and 1 are regarded as strong whereas those between ±0.5 and 0 are regarded as weak.

The data is plotted in a scattergram as shown in the examples given below

Examples:

Types of correlation coefficients

  2. Spearman coefficient

Coefficient of Determination (CD) =  r2

It is simply the percentage variability in one factor due to change in another variable.

questions.text: During a study conducted to assess the effect of smoking on life expectancy, the correlation coefficient was found to be 0.60. Calculate the coefficient of determination for this study.
questions.solution:
The coefficient of determination (CD) for this study is 0.36 (36%).

It is calculated by r2, where r is the correlation coefficient. In this study, the correlation coefficient (r) is 0.6.

Hence CD = (0.6)2 = 0.36

The coefficient of determination refers to the percentage variability in one variable due to a change in the other variable. In the above study, a coefficient of determination of 0.36 means that 36% of the variation in life expectancy is accounted for by smoking.

Related Pearl: Correlation

Correlation expresses the strength and direction of the relationship between two variables in terms of a correlation coefficient. It is represented by r.

  • Values of r vary from -1 (perfect negative correlation) to +1 (perfect positive correlation).
  • Value (size) of the coefficient: Indicates the strength of relationship
  • Sign of the coefficient: Indicates direction of relationship

Coefficients between ±0.5 and 1 are regarded as strong whereas those between ±0.5 and 0 are regarded as weak.

The data is plotted in a scattergram as shown in the examples given below

Examples:

Types of correlation coefficients

  1. Pearson coefficient
  2. Spearman coefficient

Coefficient of Determination (CD) =  r2

It is simply the percentage variability in one factor due to change in another variable.

questions.text: What is the best way to study relationship between two variables?
questions.solution:
A scattergram/ scatter plot is the best way to study the relationship between 2 variables.

The following image shows a scatter plot.

The following image shows a forest plot.

questions.text: A psychiatry resident is conducting a study to assess the relationship between prefrontal blood flow under cognitive load and the severity of psychotic symptoms in schizophrenic patients. He calculates the correlation coefficient as -1.24. You can therefore conclude that:

choices.text: Prefrontal blood flow is a good predictor of the severity of psychotic symptoms
Prefrontal blood flow accounts for most of the variance in symptoms
Schizophrenia causes low prefrontal blood flow
The correlation coefficient has been calculated incorrectly

questions.solution:
In this scenario, the correlation coefficient (r) of -1.24 is incorrect, as 'r' can only lie between -1 to +1. 

Related Pearl: Correlation

Correlation expresses the strength and direction of the relationship between two variables in terms of a correlation coefficient. It is represented by r.

  • Values of r vary from -1 (perfect negative correlation) to +1 (perfect positive correlation).
  • Value (size) of the coefficient: Indicates the strength of relationship
  • Sign of the coefficient: Indicates direction of relationship

Coefficients between ±0.5 and 1 are regarded as strong whereas those between ±0.5 and 0 are regarded as weak.

Types of correlation coefficients

  1. Pearson coefficient
  2. Spearman coefficient

Coefficient of Determination (CD) =  r2

It is simply the percentage variability in one factor due to change in another variable.

questions.text: In a random sample of 5000 corporate workers, the correlation coefficient of work satisfaction and life expectancy was found to be +0.7 with a p-value of 0.01. What is your interpretation?

choices.text: Work satisfaction does not improve life expectancy
Strong statistically significant positive association between the variables
70% people who enjoy work will live longer
30% people who do not enjoy work will have a shorter life expectancy

questions.solution:
The above study is statistically significant (p-value = 0.01) and indicates a strong positive correlation (correlation coefficient = +0.7) between work satisfaction and life expectancy.

Correlation is a measure of the statistical association of the variables, not a causal relationship.

Here, the coefficient of determination (r2) = 0.7 x 0.7 = 0.49. This means that 49% of the variation in life expectancy can be explained by satisfaction at work. 

Related Pearl: Correlation

Correlation expresses the strength and direction of the relationship between two variables in terms of a correlation coefficient. It is represented by r.

  • Values of r vary from -1 (perfect negative correlation) to +1 (perfect positive correlation).
  • Value (size) of the coefficient: Indicates the strength of relationship
  • Sign of the coefficient: Indicates direction of relationship

Coefficients between ±0.5 and 1 are regarded as strong whereas those between ±0.5 and 0 are regarded as weak.

The data is plotted in a scattergram as shown in the examples given below

Examples:

Types of correlation coefficients

  1. Pearson coefficient
  2. Spearman coefficient

Coefficient of Determination (CD) =  r2

It is simply the percentage variability in one factor due to change in another variable.

questions.text: A group of cardiologists found a correlation coefficient of 0.90  (p-value = 0.01) between the systolic BP and serum cholesterol levels of patients attending their clinics. Which of the following statements is an incorrect interpretation of this study?

choices.text: The magnitude of systolic BP and serum cholesterol levels are closely related
A patient with a high systolic BP is likely to have high serum cholesterol
A patient with a low systolic BP is likely to have low serum cholesterol
80% of the variation in BP can be explained by serum cholesterol and vice versa

questions.solution:
Correlation is an indicator of the strength and direction of the relationship between 2 variables, not the magnitude.

The given study is statistically significant (p-value = 0.01) with a strong positive correlation (r = +0.90) between systolic BP and cholesterol levels. Thus, it is likely that patients with high systolic BP will have high cholesterol levels and those with low BP will have low cholesterol levels.

The coefficient of determination (r2)here is 0.9 x 0.9 = 0.81. This indicates that around 80% of the variation in systolic BP among the patients can be explained by serum cholesterol levels.

Related Pearl: Correlation

Correlation expresses the strength and direction of the relationship between two variables in terms of a correlation coefficient. It is represented by r.

  • Values of r vary from -1 (perfect negative correlation) to +1 (perfect positive correlation).

  • Sign of the coefficient: Indicates direction of relationship

Coefficients between ±0.5 and 1 are regarded as strong whereas those between ±0.5 and 0 are regarded as weak.

questions.text: Among the given options, what can be the likely value of the coefficient of correlation between infant mortality rate and economic status?
questions.solution:
Among the given options, the coefficient of correlation between infant mortality rate and economic status (r) is likely to be -0.8. 

It is known that low economic status is associated with a high infant mortality rate. This indicates a negative correlation. However, the infant mortality rate is also influenced by other factors, indicating a moderate correlation (not equal to 1). This makes -0.8 the most likely value of correlation.

Related Pearl: Correlation

questions.text: High salt intake in individuals is associated with high blood pressure. What type of correlation is this?
questions.solution:
An increase in blood pressure with salt intake is an example of a positive correlation.

The association of decreased life expectancy with increased smoking is an example of negative correlation. 

Related Pearl: Correlation

Correlation expresses the strength and direction of the relationship between two variables in terms of a correlation coefficient. It is represented by r.

  • Values of r vary from -1 (perfect negative correlation) to +1 (perfect positive correlation).

questions.text: A scattergram was plotted as shown below to study the relationship between two variables. What is the correct interpretation?

choices.text: There is correlation between both variables and the Pearson’s coefficient is 1
There is correlation between both variables and the Pearson’s coefficient is – 1
There is non-linear correlation between both variables
There is no association between both variables

questions.solution:
The given scattergram depicts a non-linear correlation between the two variables. 

Correlation expresses the strength and direction of the relationship between two variables in terms of a correlation coefficient. There are two types of correlation coefficients:

Pearson coefficient Spearman coefficient
Used for data with continuous intervals Used for data with discrete ordered intervals

Used to find linear relationships

(e.g. salt intake vs blood pressure)

Used to find linear or non-linear relationships

(e.g. socioeconomic status vs parity)

Related Pearl: Correlation

questions.text: What conclusion can be drawn from the following scattergram?

choices.text: There is a perfect negative correlation between the two variables
There is a high positive correlation between the two variables
There is a high negative correlation between the two variables
There is a perfect positive correlation between the two variables

questions.solution:
The given scattergram shows a high negative correlation between the two variables.

questions.text: The value of one parameter can be estimated from another related parameter by:
questions.solution:
The value of one parameter can be estimated from another related parameter by using regression techniques.

Related Pearl: Regression

When two variables are correlated, the value of one of the variables can be predicted from the value of the other using regression techniques.

  • Independent variable: The variable from which the other variable is calculated.
  • Dependent variable: The variable for which the value is calculated.

Types of regression:

1. Simple linear regression

  • In this, the value of one variable (y) is used to predict the value of another variable (x).
  • The regression equation is used for this purpose. It gives a straight-line relationship between the two variables.
  • It is given by the equation y = a + bx, where, a is a constant called the intercept constant and b is the regression coefficient.
  • The intercept constant is the point where the Y-axis is intercepted by the regression line. 

 2. Multiple linear regression

  • In this, more than one variable is used to predict the expected value of another variable (y).
  • Here, the expected value of y = a + b1x1 + b2x2…..bnxn where b1 and b2…..bn represent different regression coefficients and x1, x2…….xn represents the known variables.

 3. Logistic regression

  •  In some situations, we are not interested in a numerical outcome (like risk, etc) but we want a nominal or categorical one (like death/survival, developing a disease/not developing a disease)
  • Here, the relationship between the variables will not be a linear one as the outcome from survival to death in relationship with the risk factor can change suddenly. Thus these outcomes are represented by 0 and 1.
  • Using a mathematical logistic function we can transform linear regression data, such that the values of a variable y are limited to the range of 0 to 1, which would give us the probability of y occurring for the given values of variable x.

questions.text: If correlation is given by the equation y = a + bx, what would be the nature of the graph?
questions.solution:
The equation, y = a + bx indicates a straight line.

  •  In some situations, we are not interested in a numerical outcome (like risk, etc) but we want a nominal or categorical one (like death/survival, developing a disease/not developing a disease)
  • Here, the relationship between the variables will not be a linear one as the outcome from survival to death in relationship with the risk factor can change suddenly. Thus these outcomes are represented by 0 and 1.

questions.text: Look at the image below and select the linear regression equation corresponding to the graph.
questions.solution:
Among the given options, the equation y=11+2x corresponds to the linear regression equation of the form y=α + βx.
 
When 2 variables are correlated, such that the dependent variable is represented on the y-axis and the independent variable on the x-axis, then the value of y can be obtained by using the linear regression equation y = α + βx, where:
 
y - dependent variable
α - intercept
β - slope of the line
x - independent variable
 
In the equation y=11+2x, the intercept(α) = 11, while the  slope of the line (β) = 2.
  
Option A: y=10-x, represents an intercept of 10, and a slope of -1 indicating a negative correlation. However, the given image shows a positive correlation.

Options B and D: They do not fit the linear regression equation of the form y = α + βx.

questions.text: In a study, the total cholesterol was calculated as a + b₁x₁ + b₂x₂ + b₃ x₃, where x₁ indicates calorie intake, x₂ indicates physical activity, and x₃ indicates body mass index. What is this an example of?
questions.solution:
The given equation of y = a + b1x1 +b2x2…..bnxn is an example of multiple linear regression.

In this equation:

b1, b2…..bn represent different regression coefficients

x1, x2…….xn represent the known variables

questions.text: An epidemiologist has determined five independent factors influencing the outcome of a particular disease. Which of the following statistical methods can he use to compare these factors?
questions.solution:
In this scenario, the outcome to be determined (dependent variable) is the occurrence of the disease, which is categorical (qualitative) in nature. Logistic regression can be used when a categorical dependent variable is being compared with either a categorical or numerical independent variable.

Linear regression is used when the outcome is numerical.

  Dependent variable (outcome)

Independent variable 

(risk factors, exposure)

  

Qualitative (categorical)

Quantitative (numerical)
Qualitative (categorical)

Logistic regression

Chi-square

Linear regression

T-test

ANOVA 
Quantitative (numerical) Logistic regression  

Linear regression

questions.text: What test is used to compare Kaplan-Meier survival curves?
questions.solution:
The Cox proportional hazards test is used to compare Kaplan-Meier survival curves.

Survival analysis is used for analyzing the expected duration of time until one event occurs, such as death. The following methods are used for this are:

  • Life table analysis 
  • Kaplan-Meier analysis - it involves calculating the survival function (the probability that a person will survive past a certain time)

Life tables and survival functions are graphically represented in a Kaplan-Meier plot or curve.

questions.text: Which of the following is not used to compare survival curves?
questions.solution:
Fisher’s exact test is not used to compare survival curves. The following tests are used to compare the survival curves or Kaplan-Meier curves:

  • Mantel-Haenszel test 
  • Log-rank test  
  • Cox regression or Cox proportional hazards analysis

questions.text: What is the Spearman coefficient used to determine?
questions.solution:
Spearman coefficient is used to determine correlation. It is used to find linear or non-linear relationships for data with discrete ordered intervals. 

Pearson correlation coefficient is used to find linear relationships for data with continuous intervals. 

Related Pearl: Correlation

Correlation expresses the strength and direction of the relationship between two variables in terms of a correlation coefficient. It is represented by r.

  • Values of r vary from -1 (perfect negative correlation) to +1 (perfect positive correlation).
  • Value (size) of the coefficient: Indicates the strength of relationship
  • Sign of the coefficient: Indicates direction of relationship

Coefficients between ±0.5 and 1 are regarded as strong whereas those between ±0.5 and 0 are regarded as weak.

The data is plotted in a scattergram as shown in the examples given below

Examples:

Types of correlation coefficients

  2. Spearman coefficient

It is simply the percentage variability in one factor due to change in another variable.

questions.text: A researcher wants to compare a newly developed test for COVID with the gold standard test. Which of the following methods can he use?
questions.solution: The Bland-Altmann analysis is used for comparing a newly developed test with another test, which usually is the gold standard. This method involves the graphical construction of a Bland-Altmann plot which is used to compare the measurements from both methods.
